Description: A collection of many short cylindrical beads: of generally uniform diameter, made from reddish-coloured steatite, now strung together.
Curator's comments: These beads were found in an undisturbed child's burial. Also from this burial: beads (1929,1015.237 & 1929,1015.240) shells (1929,1015.239). Bibliography: G. Brunton, ‘Mostagedda and the Tasian Culture’ (London, 1937), 40; pl. XXII, 46; Grave register, pl. IX; Bead corpus, pl. XXXIX, 86F19, 23.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (30)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 2006-present, Glasgow, Kelvingrove Art Gallery and Museum, LT Loan Ancient Egypt British Museum Partnership Gallery
